summary: Mark Carney, Governor of the Bank of England, elaborates on the Bank's strategy to support future financial developments, highlighting digital innovation, regulatory measures, and SME funding.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a solid blue background, transitioning to a screen displaying the text "sibos LONDON 23 - 26 Sep 2019" in white font. The scene then shifts to a man in a dark suit and patterned tie, standing against a plain white background. The "sibos" logo is visible in the top left corner. Subtitles appear at the bottom of the screen, reading, "It's great to be part of this year's Sibos conference." The man, identified as Mark Carney, Governor of the Bank of England, continues speaking, with subtitles stating, "which is being hosted in London for the very first time." He elaborates on London's status as a leading FinTech hub, with subtitles reading, "and it's now also one of the world's leading FinTech hubs." The man then addresses the audience, saying, "And I know you're gonna spend most of your time, right," followed by, "but I want to take this short opportunity." The video concludes with the man stating, "to support your efforts to create the future of finance," emphasizing the importance of the conference in shaping the future of finance.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with gentle, dreamy instrumental music, creating an anticipatory mood. A male speaker with a measured tone begins speaking, setting the scene for the annual Sibos Conference in London. He notes that London has "long been the heart of the global financial system", and promises to outline the Bank of England's "ambitious plan to support your efforts to create the future of finance". Then, the music transitions and ends.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a blue background featuring the text "THE FUTURE OF FINANCE" and a subtitle "As this conference recognises," followed by a man in a suit and tie speaking against a white background. The text "INCREASED - digitisation - connectivity" appears, emphasizing the growing importance of these factors in finance. The narrative continues with the text "New economy requires a new finance" and "A new finance to serve the digital economy," highlighting the need for innovation and resilience in the financial sector. The scene transitions to a blue background with the "BANK OF ENGLAND" logo and the text "Enable innovation Empower competition," stressing the bank's role in fostering innovation and competition. The video concludes with the text "all while insuring the resilience of the financial system," underscoring the importance of maintaining financial stability amidst these changes. Throughout the video, the "sibos" logo is visible in the top left corner, indicating the conference's branding.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker addressing a conference, noting the increasing digitization of the world and the need for "a new finance" to serve the digital economy, one that balances innovation with resilience and requires a "new Bank of England." His tone is formal and articulate. He then says he will take a few moments to expand.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie speaking directly to the camera against a plain white background. The logo "sibos" is visible in the top left corner throughout the video. The man discusses the evolving nature of commerce and the digital economy, emphasizing the shift towards real-time transactions and the indistinguishability of payments across borders. Subtitles at the bottom of the screen provide a translation of his speech, highlighting the increasing importance of digital payments and the need for private innovation to meet these demands. The man maintains a professional demeanor, with his facial expressions and gestures underscoring the significance of his message. The video maintains a consistent visual style, focusing on the speaker and his message without any distractions from the background or additional visual elements.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing the digital economy and its impact on commerce. He mentions that online sales are increasing and cash usage is declining, and describes the demands this new economy places on the financial system. He speaks in a measured, formal tone. Following the speaker, there is a short pause.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie speaking against a plain white background, with the logo "sibos" visible in the top left corner. He discusses the recent changes in the payment system RTGS, highlighting that commercial banks previously had direct access to it, but now, with the emergence of distributed finance, a broader set of firms can plug into the system. The scene transitions to a blue background with text stating "5 payment service providers already members of RTGS" and "20 new firms ready to join RTGS," indicating the expansion of RTGS membership. The video then shows a slide titled "RTGS rebuild: to provide API access to users to read and write payments data," emphasizing the system's modernization. The man continues to speak, mentioning the global impact of these changes, which speed up settlement processes worldwide. The video maintains a professional and informative tone throughout, focusing on the evolution and accessibility of the RTGS system.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker discussing commercial banks having direct access to the core payment system, RTGS, noting that it is becoming "increasingly anachronistic". He mentions the bank making it easier for a "broader set of firms" to compete with banks. He highlights that they are the "first G20 central bank" to do so and that there are "another 20 firms looking to join". Speaking in a confident, informative tone, he adds that RTGS will provide "API access to users to read and write payments data". The speech continues, concluding with the standardization of payment formats.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie speaking directly to the camera against a plain white background. The logo "sibos" is visible in the top left corner throughout the video. The man appears to be delivering a speech or presentation, as indicated by the subtitles at the bottom of the screen. The subtitles provide context to his speech, discussing the bank's use of opportunities, the rebuild of RTGS, and the importance of platform-based finance for SMEs (small and medium-sized enterprises). He emphasizes the significance of SMEs to the economy and highlights the challenges they face in accessing external finance. The man's facial expressions and gestures suggest he is engaged in conveying important information, with a serious and professional demeanor. The video maintains a consistent visual style, focusing on the speaker and his message without any distractions from the background or additional visual elements.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing the bank's utilization of the RTGS rebuild to promote more competitive, platform-based finance for SMEs. He describes SMEs as the "engine room of our economy," adding that a significant portion do not plan to use external finance due to the perceived hassle of applying to banks. The speaker continues, noting that a substantial percentage of those who have approached their bank have been rejected.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie speaking directly to the camera against a plain white background. The 'sibos' logo is visible in the top left corner. The man discusses the challenges faced by small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in accessing funding, highlighting the issue of assets such as brand value and user base. The scene transitions to a blue background with digital graphics, including icons of houses, cars, and Wi-Fi signals, emphasizing the RTGS rebuild's role in closing the funding gap for SMEs. Text overlays explain how data is used to identify valuable business information and securely share it with potential finance providers. The video returns to the man, who elaborates on the RTGS rebuild's impact on SME lending in the UK, enhancing competition and improving access to finance. The overall atmosphere is professional and informative, with a focus on financial solutions for SMEs.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio features a male speaker discussing the challenges SMEs face in borrowing against intangible assets like brand value or user base, contrasting them with traditional physical assets. He notes the lack of credit track records for SMEs and suggests that in today's data-rich world, this shouldn't be a problem. He then emphasizes the need for SMEs to identify and share relevant data with potential finance providers. He mentions the Bank of England's initiative to create an open platform for SME lending in the UK, aiming to streamline access to finance.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie speaking directly to the camera against a plain white background. The 'sibos' logo is visible in the top left corner throughout the video. The man discusses the Bank of England's efforts to expand access to its balance sheet to new payment providers, emphasizing the potential benefits for monetary policy transmission and financial stability. He highlights the advantages for UK households and businesses, such as cost reduction and faster delivery. The video maintains a professional and informative tone, with the speaker's expressions and gestures reinforcing the points made in the subtitles, which are displayed at the bottom of the screen in English. The consistent background and attire suggest a formal presentation or interview setting.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing the Bank of England consulting on opening access to its own balance sheet to new payment providers, emphasizing that expanding access can improve monetary policy, increase competition, and support financial stability, while also improving services, cutting costs, and speeding delivery for UK households and businesses. He then highlights the enormous potential for transformation in retail payments. The speaker maintains a measured and informative tone throughout.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie, standing against a plain white background, delivering a speech. The logo "sibos" is visible in the top left corner throughout the video. The man begins by stating, "I'll give one example, Stablecoins," and continues to explain that stablecoins seek to offer digital payment via instruments that retain a reliable value. He emphasizes that if designed and regulated appropriately, stablecoins can substantially improve financial inclusion and dramatically lower the cost of domestic transactions. The man maintains a professional demeanor, with a serious expression, as he discusses the potential benefits of stablecoins in the financial sector. The video maintains a consistent visual style, focusing on the speaker and his message without any distractions from the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features one male speaker discussing stablecoins, emphasizing their potential to improve financial inclusion and reduce payment costs if designed and regulated well. The speaker speaks in a neutral and informative tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a suit and tie, standing against a plain white background, delivering a speech. The text overlay at the bottom of the screen provides subtitles of his speech, which discusses the Bank of England's approach to innovation. The video begins with a blue screen displaying the Bank of England logo and the text "BANK OF ENGLAND Approach innovation with an open mind, not an open door." The man emphasizes the importance of solving problems for consumers while ensuring that standards and regulations are in place before any launch. The video transitions between the man speaking and the blue screen with the Bank of England logo and text, highlighting the institution's stance on innovation. The atmosphere is professional and informative, with the man's attire and the plain background reinforcing the formal tone of the presentation.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing how the Bank of England is approaching innovations such as stable coins. He states they have "an open mind, but not an open door", and they want to make sure that solving one problem doesn't "inadvertently create other more systemic ones". He argues that the "terms of engagement" for payment innovations must be adopted in advance of any launch and they want to engage early on with innovators. Background music with a calm and slightly melancholic tone plays throughout the speech.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie speaking directly to the camera against a plain white background. The logo "sibos" is visible in the top left corner throughout the video. The man discusses the importance of meeting the highest standards of prudential regulation for systemically important payment systems. He elaborates on the need to address issues ranging from anti-money laundering to data protection. The man emphasizes leveraging their position to lead the way on these issues through forums such as the G7, the FSB, and the BIS. He then transitions to discussing the strengthening of the system. The video maintains a professional and formal atmosphere, with the man's attire and the plain background contributing to the serious tone of the discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: A man speaks in a formal, authoritative tone, stating that "systemically important payment systems will have to meet the highest standards" and outlining regulations related to anti-money laundering, data protection, and operational resilience. He mentions that the Bank of England is helping to lead in these areas through forums like the G7, FSB, and BIS. Then, he says he will now "turn to strengthening the system in the face of new risks".

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a man in a suit and tie speaking against a plain white background, with the logo "sibos" visible in the top left corner. The text on the screen reads, "Today the key competitive advantage in financial services is how firms and their supervisors, collect, store, analyze, and act on data." The scene transitions to a blue background with geometric shapes and the text "Data is key to competitive advantage," followed by a list of words: "Collection, Storage, Analysis." The man continues speaking, and the text changes to "and AI could herald leaner, faster, and more efficient operations." The video then shows a blue background with binary code and the text "A quarter of major banks activities are already hosted on the cloud." The next frame displays the text "Banking 2nd biggest global spender on AI systems," with a subtitle stating, "biggest global spender on AI systems." The video concludes with the man speaking again, with the text "and if properly managed, they can improve the" displayed on the screen. Throughout the video, the man maintains a professional demeanor, and the background remains consistent with the "sibos" logo visible in the top left corner.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a single male speaker discussing the importance of data in financial services, stating "the key competitive advantage" is data collection and analysis. He describes the use of cloud and AI technologies for "leaner, faster, and more tailored financial services", noting that "almost one third of all UK payments activities" are cloud hosted. His tone is informative and professional. He adds that banking is a "second biggest global spender on AI systems" and claims these savings can be passed to customers. The audio then transitions to a new, unidentifiable sound.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie speaking directly to the camera against a plain white background. The logo "sibos" is visible in the top left corner throughout the video. The man appears to be delivering a formal speech or presentation, as indicated by his professional attire and the serious tone of his expression. Subtitles appear at the bottom of the screen, providing a translation of his speech in English. The subtitles read: "For these reasons, the Bank of England is very open to greater adoption of the cloud and usage of AI. To ensure the benefits of cloud computing are realised and that the associated risks are well managed, the bank is going to issue a supervisory statement, in the autumn, that sets out our new approach." The man's facial expressions and mouth movements suggest that he is actively speaking, and his posture remains upright and professional throughout the video. The overall atmosphere is one of a formal and informative presentation, likely related to financial or technological topics.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker expressing the Bank of England's openness to cloud adoption and AI, emphasizing the need to manage associated risks. He mentions an upcoming supervisory statement outlining their new approach. The overall tone is informative and professional.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a suit and tie speaking directly to the camera against a plain white background. The text on the screen reads, "The PRA is also exploring how new technologies could streamline firms' compliance and regulatory processes, while improving our own ability to analyse relevant data." The scene transitions to a blue background with network graphics and icons, including a computer and a smartphone, with the text "BANK OF ENGLAND" and "65 billion data points received per year." The video then returns to the man in the suit, with the text "Reviewing it all would be the equivalent of each supervisor reading the complete works of Shakespeare twice a week." The video concludes with the man continuing to speak, emphasizing the importance of technology in streamlining compliance and regulatory processes.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single male speaker discussing the PRA's exploration of new technologies to streamline compliance and regulatory processes. He gives the example of the Bank of England receiving a large amount of data, with a comparison of the magnitude of reviewing it all to the effort required to read the complete works of Shakespeare twice a week every week of the year.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie speaking directly to the camera against a plain white background. The logo "sibos" is visible in the top left corner throughout the video. The man discusses the impact of cloud and AI technologies on firms, highlighting how they have reduced the cost of storage and analysis. He mentions that the cost to the industry could range between £2 billion and £4.5 billion every year. The speaker emphasizes the opportunities for more efficient processes at every stage of supervision and suggests models where data from firms is pulled and analyzed using machine learning and AI. The video maintains a professional and informative tone, focusing on the speaker's message without any distractions from the background or additional visual elements.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating that while cloud and AI have reduced costs, regulatory submissions remain labor-intensive and costly, perhaps between two and four and a half billion pounds every year. He further asserts that there are opportunities for more efficient processes, including simplifying rules, pulling data from firms, and using machine learning and AI to analyze data. This is followed by a brief, high-pitched electronic sound.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie speaking directly to the camera against a plain white background. The logo "sibos" is visible in the top left corner throughout the video. The man appears to be delivering a formal presentation or speech, as indicated by his professional attire and the serious tone of his expression. Subtitles appear at the bottom of the screen, providing a translation of his speech in English. The subtitles read: "Last month the bank launched a review on how we host and use regulatory data and will embark on proofs of concept with firms to test how we can automatically extract regulatory data and use AI and ML to analyse it. This is a rich area for Fin Tech innovation and we'd welcome the chance to work with those of you who are interested." The man's facial expressions and mouth movements suggest that he is actively speaking and engaging with his audience. The video maintains a consistent visual style, with no significant changes in the background or the man's position, emphasizing the importance of the message being conveyed.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker outlining a bank's new review of regulatory data processes and their plans for proofs of concept with firms. The speaker describes automating data extraction, using AI and ML for analysis, and encourages collaboration with interested parties, highlighting that this is a "rich area for FinTech innovation" and then adds that he's going to conclude.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a cityscape background overlaid with financial data and text, emphasizing the potential of new finance to unlock stronger, more sustainable, and inclusive growth. The scene transitions to a man in a suit speaking against a plain white background, discussing the outlined points. The focus then shifts to a blue screen with the Bank of England logo and text highlighting the bank's role in enabling a new economy, empowering competition, and ensuring the resilience of the financial system. The video returns to the man in the suit, who continues to speak about the need for effectiveness in the financial system. Throughout the video, the 'sibos' logo is visible in the top left corner, indicating the event or organization associated with the content.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker with a formal and authoritative tone, discussing the potential of "the new finance" to unlock growth and the role of the Bank of England in enabling this. He emphasizes the importance of competition and resilience in the financial system. He concludes by stating the need and desire to engage with the audience.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie speaking directly to the camera against a plain white background. The logo "sibos" is visible in the top left corner throughout the video. The man appears to be addressing an audience, as indicated by the subtitles at the bottom of the screen. The subtitles read: "to engage with you," "During this conference you'll be seeing more of us," "on Sibos TV - not more of me thankfully for you -," "Bank of England colleagues will be participating," "And we'll be hosting a number of teach-ins," "during in the day, to give you an opportunity," and "to ask questions about our plans." The man's expressions and gestures suggest he is delivering a formal speech or presentation, likely related to the Sibos conference, which is a global financial services event. The video maintains a consistent visual style, focusing on the speaker and his message without any significant changes in the background or camera movement.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker announcing, "During this conference, you'll be seeing more of us on Sibos TV." He adds jokingly, "Not more of me, thankfully for you." He then mentions Bank of England colleagues participating in panels and hosting teachings during the day for attendees to ask questions about their plans. The speaker's tone is professional and slightly humorous.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie speaking directly to the camera against a plain white background. The text "sibos" is visible in the top left corner throughout the video. The man addresses the audience, discussing the ambitions to improve finance for everyone and emphasizing that finance should serve households and entrepreneurs. The video transitions to a blue screen with the "sibos" logo and the text "LONDON 23 - 26 Sep 2019," indicating the event's location and dates. The final frame encourages viewers to "Register now on Sibos.com," providing a call to action for the event. The overall atmosphere is professional and informative, with a focus on the speaker's message and the event details.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker who sounds optimistic and says that his colleagues look forward to speaking to, and learning from, their audience. He continues with an appeal to improve finance for everyone, emphasizing that finance is not an end in itself, but a tool for households and entrepreneurs, and it is used to achieve a sustainable, inclusive, and prosperous future. He ends by thanking everyone and inviting them to enjoy the conference. Afterward, a short burst of upbeat music with electronic elements and a positive, motivational tone plays to conclude the clip.
